Madame Honorine qui est la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée. Elle est âgée de 41 ans et mère de quatre enfants dont deux filles. Avec une expérience avérée d'une quinzaine d'années Madame Honorine ne cesse de connaitre des résultats évoluer dans ses activités. Elle porte beaucoup d’intérêts à ce prêt qui lui permet de mieux développer ses projets. Les revenus servent à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group of 4 women are part of the "banc villageois" which was formed March 29, 2002. It is made up of women who participate in the same business.

Honorine, pictured on the right side of the photo with her hand raised, is the representative of the group. She is married, 41 years old, and the mother of 4 children, 2 of whom are girls. With over 15 years of experience, Honorine has been consistently seeing benefits from growing her business. She is very eager for this loan which will allow her to better expand her offerings. She will use the profits to improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and peanut paste

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor is a hardworking and ambitious woman. She is a widow and is therefore the one responsible for feeding her family.  She has 3 children who work,  but they have small incomes. Gulbahor and her family live poorly. 

Gulbahor has decided to start a new business selling fabrics in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. She will sell her merchandise at the local market. Gulbahor completed the 'To Get Ahead' course through the organization,  and learned enough skills about business. Her children will also help her with the business. 

She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy fabrics to start her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for organizing new business

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza operates a bamboo business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.  She earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Analiza is requesting a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more stocks of bamboo to sell to her customers. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to expand her business to secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Carolina works hard to support her family.

She has a food production business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle transportation. Carolina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food business.

Carolina has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Teona

texts.en:
Teona is a 31-year-old young lady who lives in the Khelvachauri district with her husband, two toddler children and mother-in-law. The family’s economic activity is a small bakery where Khachapuri (Georgian traditional cheese pie) is baked. Teona bakes them herself and works hard all day long to generate an income.

Her project is successful as Teona is an experienced baker who always has high quality production. This is why Teona has decided to start another bakery in a hired commercial space.  The location is great and Teona hopes that this initiative will be lucrative as well.  

With the received amount, she will buy all the needed equipment for baking and expand her business. Her husband and mother-in-law will help her to run the business.

Teona awaits your support.

loans.use: to start up a Khachapuri (Georgian cheese pie) bakery

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en: Amneh was born in 1978. She is a divorced woman who lives with her parents in a rented house in a sector of Jordan called Dairalla. Amneh has been working at her rented beauty salon for 1 year. She is planning to expand her project as she found it a good source of income. She wants to buy more hair dryers and other tools to be more productive and to earn better profit in order to support herself and her family. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more hair dryers and other tools for the salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current stock levels of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, which will allow her to sell greater quantities of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish, which will help her improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Rose Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of three members and all are females. They live in the same neighborhood and are involved in the trading of jewelry boxes, plates, cutlery sets, and maize. 

Rose, who sells products such as maize, is very excited to receive her seventh loan from ID-Ghana, after having repaid her previous loans and thus taken a step towards expanding her business. With this loan, she is planning to use 800 GHS to purchase a bag of maize to sell to customers. 

Rose says that her most important challenge and goal is to set up a distribution depot where she can sell all of her items instead of going outside and walking in her community and others nearby. She enjoys being at home with her long-term husband and three children. She is planning to reinvest her profits in her business and save for her future plans and challenges. 

The group needs a total amount of 2,100 GHS to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of maize and to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Mabinty from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children.  In 2010, Mabinty established her local food business. She began her business because she wanted to generate her own source of income. She works at her business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business and the poor road network.

Mabinty requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and gari to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Mabinty plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Boucotte Sindian Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de 15 femmes est créé le 29 Mars 2002. Elle se sont constituées par affinité. Madame Anna qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante. Elle est veuve âgée. Elle est âgée de 63 ans et mère de deux enfants. Elle s'active dans la vente d'huile de palme, de citron et de miel depuis plusieurs années. Elle compte acheter avec le prêt sollicité 20 litre d'huile de palme, 60 litre de citron et 20 litre de miel. Les bénéfices générés par son activité seront destinés à la prise en charges de sa famille( nourriture, santé et scolarité etc).
texts.en: This group of 15 women was created March 29, 2002, out of a group of women who knew each other as friends. Anna, pictured on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the representative of the group. She is an older widow, 63 years old and the mother of two children. She has been in the business of selling palm oil, lemon juice, and honey for many years. She plans to use her loan to purchase 20 liters of palm oil, 60 liters of lemon juice, and 20 liters of honey. She will use the profits generated from her business for providing for her family (food, health, schooling, etc.)

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, lemon juice, and honey

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, which will allow her to sell greater quantities of baked goods.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
This is Nestor, 40, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. He is a father to his children. By the grace of God, Nestor has managed to support his children's schooling. At this time, he is working hard to continually send his children to school to finish their studies.

Nestor oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. They have a jeepney that has a capacity of 18 persons, and is paying a boundary (daily quota) each day. 

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 40,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy new tires for the jeepney and renew his registration.

Nestor dreams that his business will continue to grow and hopes that his children will finish their education. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.

Footnote: Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy new tires and renew the registration of the jeepney unit.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 20-year-old Aminata from Waterloo 2, eastern area, in Freetown. She is single with one child. In 2010, Aminata established her cake business. She began her business because she wanted to generate income to support herself and her child. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to create income to take care of her pregnancy and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Adiatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Adiatu from Waterloo2, the eastern area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with 5 children. 

She began her business because she wants to improve her family. In 2007, Adiatu established her general stock business. She works at the business 9 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Adiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks, and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Adiatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks, and pure water.

loans.name: Al-Safa Group

texts.en:
This group is called the Al-Safa Group. It consists of 3 members who are all women. The members of this group are very hardworking, trustworthy and responsible women. They are from Sana'a and they know each other very well. 

Nabeela, 37 years old, is the group leader who acquired her profession of dressmaking long ago. She chose this business because she has loved it since childhood. She benefited from the first loan. Now she has applied for a second loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase sewing machines and more fabrics to expand her business and attract more customers. All of the group members are grateful for the financing of the first loan.

loans.use: to purchase sewing machines and more fabrics to expand her business and attract more customers.

loans.name: Elisam

texts.en:
Elisam, a hardworking married man, is aged 30 and has three children. He operates a motorcycle taxi to earn income to meet his family's needs and pay tuition for his children. He operates a retail shop to supplement his income.

He needs the loan to buy a new motorcycle because the one he has apparently is old and keeps breaking down. The new motorcycle will help him to get more customers, and therefore, increase his income. He is hardworking and creative.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine previously requested a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

Christine is requesting another loan for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better profit, which will help her to sustain her daily needs. 

Christine meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and God.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
Meet 23-year-old Mamusu, who is from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married, with two children. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 2011, Mamusu established her used clothing business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says her main challenge is the lack of enough capital to run her business.

Mamusu requires a loan to buy more used clothing to expand her business. She hopes the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. 

In the future; Mamusu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to expand her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo2 in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with 5 children. In 2008, Kadiatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to generate her own source of income. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil, coconut and rice. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, coconut and rice to expand her business.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia is 62 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a business of selling coconut in the Philippines and she has been in this business for six years. 

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more coconut to sell to customers. In the future, Rogelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
to purchase more fish to sell, thus 
improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Sabokhor

texts.en:
Sabokhor was born in 1965 and she is a hardworking woman with a great desire to progress in life. She is married and has three children. They live together in the southern part of Tajikistan. 

She is one of the successful businesswomen of her town. For more than one year she has been busy selling fabrics. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills help her to develop business and in this way improve living conditions. She manages her business alone. She wants to increase her working capital and to develop her business further but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy.

This is the 14th loan she is requesting from IMON and she feels deeply grateful for the economic support she has received to achieve her goals. She is also grateful to the support received by the members of her Imon International as she trusts them and feels at ease with them.

loans.use: To buy fabrics to increase her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase five bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloth materials

loans.name: Yelizaveta

texts.en:
Yelizaveta lives in the city Kadjaran which is in Syunik region. She is married and has two children. Her daughter is married and she lives with her family. Her son is also married and he lives with his parents. Yelizaveta works at the hospital as a nurse. Her husband is an electrician. Their son works as a worker in a small workshop. So all of them work night and day, very hard, in order to provide for their family and also to be able to pay for Yelizaveta’s grandson’s treatment.

 Her grandson is seriously ill and Yelizaveta is asking for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams in order to pay for her grandson's medicine and treatment as well.

loans.use: to pay for her grandson's medicine and treatment as well

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell, thus improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more to ingredients for her porridge.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 26 years old and supports her family in Ndola by operating a Zoona mobile money transfer business.  

Mercy first got connected to Kiva lenders in July 2012, when she accessed some start-up capital to start running her own business. She was able to purchase a trading booth and two phones and the remainder of the money is what she uses to serve customers who need to access financial services from her booth.  She set up the booth in her hometown of Ndola.

Now, Mercy is requesting a loan to grow her business.  She has constraints to growing her business because she has a low amount of working capital.  This prohibits her from serving as many customers as she could with adequate cash on hand.  If she could service more customers, she would earn more profits.    

Mercy is hopeful that this loan will help her grow the business and earn more profits. The profits will go towards improving her standard of living. She says the first Kiva loan helped her establish her business.  Now, she believes the second will help her grow the business.  She is grateful for the support of the Kiva lending community.

loans.use: To grow her mobile money transfer business by servicing more customers in need of financial services

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita con 30 años de edad, estado civil madre soltera de dos hijos, vive en la comunidad de Colomi, con una instrucción de nivel primaria.Es una mujer trabajadora muy responsable con sus obligaciones y actividad, cuenta con una actividad principal que es la producción agrícola, con ingresos económicos de la venta estacional de haba en vaina verde y papa (nos dice también que el padre de sus hijos no se encuentra aquí por motivos de trabajo).La señora comenta que quiere hacer construir un cuarto más en su casa para así poder vivir más cómoda junto a sus hijos, por este motivo solicita un crédito. Finalmente Margarita indica que siempre trabajara arduamente para poder mantener a sus hijos y tener una mejor casa en el futuro.
texts.en:
Margarita is 30 years old a single (legally) mother of two children. She lives in the community of Colomi. She completed her primary schooling. She is a hard-working person who is very responsible with her obligations and work. Her main activity is agricultural production, her revenues coming from the seasonal sales of broad beans and potatoes (She also tells us that the father of her children is not there because of work).

Margarita comments that she wants to build another room onto her house in order to be able to live more comfortably with her children. So she is requesting a loan. Lately Margarita indicates that she will always work hard in order to support her children and have a better home in the future.

loans.use: to construct another room on her house.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric started rearing cattle and selling them when his first children joined secondary school. He therefore needed more money to cover their increased tuition. 

He thanks Ugafode for giving him quarterly repayments because by then he will have made enough money to repay his loan without challenges. He is grateful that the Kiva lenders are interested in partnering with him.

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar-charging set, and weighing scale so he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: A1101315 Group

texts.fr: Madame Akouavi née en 1985 est coiffeuse de profession. Célibataire, elle a 02 enfants en charge dont 01 scolarisé.  Elle a démarré en 2011 et exerce l'activité à Aného(Localité située à environ 50Km de la ville de Lomé) et s'approvisionne à Lomé. Elle sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter  des matériels de travail. Le profit l'aidera à acheter plus de marchandises afin d'augmenter son activité. Elle espère aussi assurer la santé et la scolarité des enfants. Madame Akouavi fait partie d'un groupement dont elle est la responsable constitué de femmes et d'hommes. Ils sont tous dans le commerce(vente de planches, de beignets, d'alimentation générale...). Ils espèrent eux aussi comme leur responsable assurer un bon avenir à leurs enfants tout en rendant pérenne leurs activités.
texts.en: Born in 1985, Madam Akouavi is a hairdresser by profession. Single, she has 2 dependent children of whom 1 goes to school. She started her business in 2011 and practices her business in Aného (located about 50km from the town of Lomé) and gets her supplies in Lomé. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy working materials. The profits will help her to buy more merchandise in order to expand her business. She also hopes to ensure the health and the schooling of her children. Madam Akouavi is part of a group made up of men and women, of which she is the leader. They are all in business (selling planks, doughnuts, general foodstuffs...). Like their leader, they also hope to ensure a good future for their children while making their businesses sustainable.

loans.use: to buy working tools and products to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of plantains.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline, 50, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married and she has children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Evangeline operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 10,000 as a loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Evangeline hopes to have a grocery store someday and dreams that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Konnie

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Konnie from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children.  In 2008, Konnie established her local food business. She began her business because she wanted to generate her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business and sometimes vehicles break down on the way.

Konnie requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and 'gari' to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Konnie plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and 'gari' (cassava grits) to expand her business.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
El Señor José tiene 47 años de edad está casado, con quien tiene tres hijos, el vive en una provincia cerca de la ciudad de Cochabamba.
José es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, el tuvo una vida muy triste desde pequeño, ya que con la única que se crio fue con su madre ya que el padre ni siquiera lo reconoció, él y su madre se vinieron de la ciudad de Potosí y ella se puso a trabajar para poderlo sacar adelante a José,  pero el solo pudo terminar el colegio ya que se puso a trabajar desde muy joven ya que la madre se enfermo y a él toco trabajar y no podía estudiar al mismo tiempo, ya que su empleo era de albañil; su madre falleció y él se quedo solo y ahí fue cuando la conoció a su esposa quien siempre le apoya en todo momento.
José trabaja con su vehículo prestando los servicios de radiotaxi, el trabaja desde muy temprano en el recojo de escolares y al mismo tiempo tiene usuarios que lo buscan por lo responsable que es en su trabajo, el solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar su casa, ya que el sueña con una vida mejor para sus niñas que él dice que quiere un futuro mejor para ellas.
texts.en:
José is 47 years old, married and has three children. He lives in a province close to the city of Cochabamba. Jose is a very hard-working and responsible man. He has had a very hard life since he was young. He was just born when he left with his mother as his father would not even acknowledge him. They went to the city of Potosi where she started to work in order to support José. But he couldn't finish secondary school. He started to work very young when his mother got sick. He worked as a bricklayer and could not work and study at the same time. His mother died and he was left alone. He then met his wife whom he has supported at all times. 

José works in his vehicle offering radio-taxi service. He starts very early picking up school children. He also has regular customers who look for him as he is very responsible in his work.

The loan José is requesting is to buy construction materials to finish building his house. He dreams of a better life for his daughters. He says he wants a better future for them all.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house.

loans.name: Fatou Bintou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe constitué de 4 femmes ont pratiquement les mêmes objectifs. Elles habitent la même localité et entretiennent de bons rapports de cohabitation. Madame Agathe qui est à la droite de la photo est la représentante du groupe. Elle est célibataire. Elle est âgée de 44 ans et mère de trois enfants dont deux garçon. Elle s'active dans la vente d'habillement depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle compte avec ce prêt sollicité, renforcer son activité en achetant plus d'habits. Avec les revenus générés par son activité, elle parvient à assurer la nourriture de ses enfants et de subvenir à leurs besoins.
texts.en: This group is made of up 4 women who have practically the same objectives. They live in the same area and sustain good relationships. Madam Agathe who is on the right in the photo is the leader of the group. She is single. She is 44 years old and mother to three children of whom two are boys. She has been selling clothing for more than 10 years. With this requested loan she plans to strengthen her business by buying more clothing. With the income generated by her business, she manages to ensure the food for her children and to meet their needs.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Boucotte Peyrissac Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de 4 femme est constitué suit à la bonne progression des membres dans le travail d'équipe et au bon voisinage. Madame Khady, à droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est âgé de 38 ans  Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont deux filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de crevettes séchées depuis des années. Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt sollicité 45 kilogramme de crevettes séchées qu'elle va livrer à ses clients. Les bénéfices tirés de l'activité serviront de participer aux frais de scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
This group of 4 women is made up of working group members and neighbors. Khady, pictured on the right with her hand raised, is the representative of the group. She is 38 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children, 2 of whom are girls.

Khady has been in the business of selling dried shrimp for several years. She plans to use this loan to purchase 45kg of dried shrimp which she will deliver to customers. She will then use the profits from this business to help with the schooling costs for her children.

loans.use: to purchase dried shrimp

loans.name: Edick

texts.en:
Edick and his wife Chola operate a service where local Zambians can safely send and receive mobile money.  After a successful year they are ready to scale up their operation to a second location in the Woodlands area of Zambia’s capital city, Lusaka.  

Capitalizing on the success of their first loan, they have requested a second loan to top-up on the money they have saved to open a new outlet. The money will be used to serve customers sending and receiving money from their shop. Edick and Chola say that with the additional capital to open a second shop in a different location, they will be able to earn more profit.

Edick and Chola would like to thank Kiva and the Kiva lenders for the opportunity they have provided them with to grow their business and improve their lives.

loans.use: To grow his mobile money business by opening up another shop so that he and his wife can serve more customers in need of financial services

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.en:
This is Purificacion, 54, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She has a child and she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Purificacion operates a printing business. She mainly offers signboards, sticker boards, tarpaulins and other printed materials used in business establishments, schools and such. They buy their materials and supplies for printing and manufacture different printed materials that their customers require. Her regular customers are business owners, students and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy materials like paper, ink and other supplies needed for her business. 

Purificacion dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a better standard of living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials like paper, ink and other supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy braids, weaves, relaxers and hair treatment chemicals

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Zainab from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has five children.  In 2001, Zainab established her local food business. She began her business in order to generate her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business and transportation problems.

Zainab requires a loan in order to purchase more cassava, beans, and potatoes to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business.  In the future, Zainab plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, beans, and potatoes to expand her business.

loans.name: Sechelanji

texts.en:
Sechelanji is 21 years old and pursuing a diploma in Pharmacy. She operates a Zoona mobile money business, which helps pay for her education costs. She started her business in 2010, and it is her sole source of income. She works hard to serve her customers and grow her business. With her profits she also supports her parents who are both unemployed.

Sechelanji is requesting a loan in order to increase her working capital. This will enable her to serve more customers and earn more profit. She explains how working capital is her biggest business challenge because she does not have the necessary collateral to access a traditional bank loan to fund her business. Knowing this, she is very greatful to be connected with the Kiva community.  

Sechelanji’s dream is to complete school, become a successful pharmacist, and open additional Zoona mobile money outlets to earn a stable income.

loans.use: To increase her working capital so that she can serve more customers and earn more profit.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace, a married woman with four children, is a cattle keeper in a rural area. She keeps cattle for milk, and also to sell at times. The business has helped her to sustain her family demands, but she gets challenged at times by cattle diseases, which lead into quarantine.  This affects her cash flow, especially when she has acquired a loan. However, she thanks Ugafode for the flexibility in the repayment terms, like being allowed to pay quarterly, which helps her to make her repayments well. She will use the loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of bread.

loans.name: Aminata M

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Aminata. She is married and has four children. 

In 2008, Aminata established her hair attachment and cosmetics business. She began her business because, when the war broke out, she relocated to Freetown with her family.  She was struggling to provide food for her family. She decided to start petty-trading with the help of a distant relative.  

After the rebel war, she returned to Makeni and continued with her trading.  Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 775,000 every month from this business. 

Aminata would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. She requires a loan in order to purchase dozens of hair products and attachments. 

In the future, Aminata plans to develop her business. Competition is her major challenge. She is grateful for being given the opportunity to access loans through the Association for Rural Development (ARD). She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy dozens of hair products and attachments.

loans.name: Fatmata A

texts.en:
Fatmata is 39 years old, widowed, and has four children. In 2009, Fatmata established her cosmetics and jewelry business. She began her business with experience from her mother who was a trader.  She and her younger sisters help in the family business until she got married.  She set up her own business with the help of her late husband.  Working seven days a week, 10 hours a day, she earns about 688,000 SLL a month. Her major challenge is competition.

Fatmata is requesting a loan from ARD for 3,000,000 SLL, which she will use to purchase jewelry for people in nearby villages. In the future, she plans to expand her business and improve her family's status.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry

loans.name: Kamo

texts.en:
Kamo is 51 years old and lives with his family in the village of Khachardzan which is in the Tavush region. He used to live in Baku, but after being back to his homeland, he got married and built a very nice and comfortable house. Since then he has been engaged in farming and agriculture, in which his whole family helps him very much. Kamo has two sons and two daughters. Both his sons are grown up and they work, and his daughters are still school-aged. Kamo’s wife works at the school as a teacher. 
At his farm Kamo breeds four cows, two bulls, three calves, twenty chickens and ten beehives.  He sells a lot of milk, and also some cheese that his wife makes. He also cultivates vegetables for his large family’s needs, but not for sale.
Kamo has decided to enlarge his farming business and to buy a cow and animal fodder.  He needs 900,000 Armenian drams to realize his plans.

loans.use: to enlarge his farming business and to buy a cow and animal fodder

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Meet 39-year-old Elizabeth from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has three children.  In 2006, Elizabeth established her local food business. She began her business to generate her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business, and price inflation.

Elizabeth requires a loan in order to purchase more cassava and potatoes to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Elizabeth plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and potatoes to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 41-year-old Mary from the Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with six children between the ages of 8 years old and 22 years old.  Two of her children attend school. She started business to earn her daily survival for her family.
 
Mary runs a Cookery business, she sells cooked food within her area and she has been running this business since 2002. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 6 days per week.   Mary says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Mary has requested a loan in order to buy cooking seasonings, oil and rice, etc. to prepare her cooked foods. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy foods like cooking seasonings, oil and rice to prepare her cooked foods for sale

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet 49-year-old Hawa from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with 8 children.  She began her business because she wanted to be self-dependent. In 2009, Hawa established her fish business.  She works at the business 9 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Hawa requires a loan in order to purchase more fish for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Hawa plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.en:
Huseyn is 50 years old, married, and has four children.  He is a hard-working and well-known grocer. In his grocery store, he provides his neighborhood with canned foods, snacks, dairy products, juices, and drinks. He has many years of experience in this field, having worked with his father since he was a young man.

Huseyn is requesting a loan for 1,500 AZN, which he will use to buy a new motor generator and to install some new shelves in his grocery store. He believes that this loan will help him to keep his dairy products fresh and will satisfy his customers leading to a better reputation and an expansion of his store.

loans.use: to purchase a new motor generator and to install new shelves

loans.name: Sirun

texts.en:
Sirun is 50 years old and she lives in Vanadzor city which is in Lori region. She is married and she lives there with her husband and retired mother-in–law. She has two daughters; both of them are already married and they live with their families. 

Sirun’s only family income is from her business in which she has been engaged for three years already. She rents a small shop where she sells food and household products (dairy products, bread, sweets, juices, cans, sausages and also washing powder, shampoos, soaps, etc.). She works without holidays and till late in the night since her shop is greatly visited. In her business her husband helps her very much and sometimes he stays at the shop when Sirun has some urgent work.

She is asking for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy some household products and some food to expand her shop assortment.

loans.use: To buy some household products and some food also to expand her shop assortment

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 28 years old, married, and has two children.  She is from the Akhalkalaki district. The only one who earns money in the household is her husband who is a constructor worker and works on house renovations.  

Ofelia would like to start a clothing sales business in her community in order to earn additional income. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase a supply of clothing at wholesale prices to start her new business. Since there are not many clothing stores in her district, Ofelia is confident that her endeavor will meet a high demand. She intends to develop positive relationships with her customers and expects to attain a good profit from her business. This start-up loan offers Ofelia a good chance to earn a more stable income and improve her family's living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing items

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Marie, from Waterloo2, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with four children.  

Marie began her business because she wanted to develop herself and her children. In 2001, Marie established her general stock business. She works at the business nine hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Marie requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks, and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. 

In the future, Marie plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks, and pure water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale, so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan  is 42 years old, married, and lives with his wife, son, and daughter-in-law.  He operates a local grocery store, which he has been doing for more than 10 years. He sells different grocery products, including flour, sweets, sugar, tea, and cakes. His wife and son help him in organizing his business. His monthly profit is 100 AZN. 

Rovshan is requesting a loan for 500 AZN, which he will use to buy new refrigerator.

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator

loans.name: Saymo

texts.en:
Saymo is a repeat client of IMON International. She is a kind and trusting woman. She has worked for more than 15 years at the university, as a cleaning woman. 

Saymo is married and has six children. Her husband is a builder. Saymo and her husband have a small income, so her family lives poorly. Their children do not have a normal source of income. She always wanted to provide her children with good living conditions. 

Some years ago, she began building a new house for her children. She does not have enough money, so she can’t finish the building of her house. She is asking for a loan of TJS 3,000 (somoni) to buy building materials, such as wood and slate. She is planning to make a roof for her new house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as wood and slate, to make a roof.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 36-year-old married Palestinian refugee, the father of one child. He runs his own small café which is a small van located by the sidewalk of a very popular street. He has run this business since 2009 and has thirteen years of experience in this field. Ahmad sells coffee as well as hot and cold drinks. He also provides a hooka for his customers who really appreciate such service.

To improve his business and increase his income, Ahmad is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a new espresso machine that will improve the quality of his service and save time.

He hopes to open an official café and restaurant instead of the current van to attract more customers and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a new espresso machine

loans.name: Xalida

texts.en:
Xalida is 58 years old. She works as a salesperson at a grocery store in the town of Agsu. She is a pleasant and thoughtful person.   

In her store, Xalida sells food items, baked goods, sweets, and household wares. She has been in this line of business for over ten years. She had no studies and no one taught her this trade. She simply opened her own store and started working and she has been doing so for ten years already. She enjoys her work and spends most of her time working. 

At present, her merchandise stock is almost depleted. All that remains are the goods displayed at the counter. She is requesting a loan of AZN 1,500 in order to stock up on fresh groceries, to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: to stock up on fresh groceries, to increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is 42 years old and married.  He sells seasonal fruits and vegetables in his place in a central bazaar and from his home, which he has been doing for one year. He knows his customers' needs and he has reliable providers because he was a merchant in a food market   He chose this business because it is profitable and brings in a stable income. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy; many national dishes are made of vegetables, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table of Azerbaijan's families. His monthly income is 120 AZN.

Iman is requesting his second loan for 1,000 AZN, which he will use to repair his market

loans.use: to repair his market

loans.name: Frunze

texts.en:
Frunze with his nice family lives in the village of Geghamavan which is in the Ghegharkunik region. He is a very skilled farmer and runs his farming perfectly and with decent income. Frunze has already once received a loan from Kiva that helped him to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer. The season's harvest was perfect, and he organized the sale of his products quickly and received a good income. 

Frunze has farm animals (cows, bulls, calves, piglets, and twenty-five beehives) and a plot of land on which he mainly cultivates potatoes, the growth of which are perfectly suited to this region. Frunze’s family income comes from the sale of his farm products, such as milk, cheese, meat, potatoes and honey.

This time Frunze has decided to ask a loan for the increase of his farm livestock and beehives, and for this he needs a loan in an amount of 1,000,000 AMD (Armenian drams).

loans.use: to the increase the number of his farm cattle and beehives

loans.name: Atyrkul

texts.ru: Атыркул 57 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. У Атыркул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Атыркул занимается животноводством, стартовав 33 года назад, с покупки скота на 14,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Атыркул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 3 козы, 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Атыркул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку кобыл для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Атыркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку дома.
texts.en: Atyrkul is 57 years old, married and raising six children together with her husband. Atyrkul has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, Atyrkul is involved in animal husbandry, having started 33 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 14,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Atyrkul's hard work, today her business contains 4 dairy cows, 1 horse, 3 goats and 5 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 14,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Atyrkul requested a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy mares in order to increase livestock headcount. Atyrkul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy mares

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Aminata from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children.  In 2012, Aminata established her local food business. She began her business because she can generate her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business and sometimes vehicles break down on the way.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more cassava and potatoes to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and potatoes to expand her business.

loans.name: Kuban

texts.en:
Kuban is a student of AUCA, department of Anthropology. Here is his story.

“I have always wanted to study at AUCA, because I see how its students differ from graduates of other universities. Students of AUCA are determined, active, curious and eager to learn and they are capable of free thinking. AUCA provides its students with priceless knowledge and practical experience. They are the ones who can totally change the future of our country. 

"I always wanted to study in the department of Anthropology, because I realize how much our country needs foreign experience in this field. Local and foreign professors conduct classes providing the most modern tools to the students. Development Anthropology is the field which interests me the most, and I am sure that studying at AUCA will help me to become a good specialist in this field. After graduation I am planning to pursue my Master’s Degree, which will help me to develop a business. I hope to be a great help to my family, and most importantly to my country and even to the whole Central Asia. 

"Besides all the above mentioned the AUCA gives a unique opportunity of loan for studies. So, I am applying for a loan too, which is given through Kiva. It will help me to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: To pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Diana's Group

texts.en:
This group is beginning its sixth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The group is comprised of 11 members, and its leader is Diana. The members' businesses are varied and include: clothing, underwear, shoes, provisions, jeans and bags. The loan they are requesting will benefit small business owners such as Diana. She has been a member of this group for three years and joined by invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution. She has been selling provisions for nine years. She learned the trade nine years ago when she helped her mother. After getting married, she opened her own shop.

The loan will increase her work capital so she can buy more provisions in the city of Accra. She will sell her products on order. This work allows her to earn enough income to support her household. She is married and has two children.  When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she says it is the soft loan, savings, and training in credit and health.  They will need a total amount of GHS 9800 to expand businesses.

loans.use: To buy more provisions in the city of Accra and sell to customers.

loans.name: Zulfuqar

texts.en: Zulfuqar  is 38 years of age. He is married and has two children.  Zulfuqar is selling mixed goods such as souvenirs, toys, umbrellas, school bags, toys of pine, etc.  He  opened a small grocery store in the city and has been running it for four months. It is a very good business and located in a crowded area. He would like to improve his business but he does not have enough money. For that Zulfuqar wants a loan 2000 azn. This loan will help him to improve his grocery store and buy all the needed stock that customers often request. This will improve his business and also the family's income. He appears in the photo while he was working in his store.

loans.use: to improve his grocery store and buy all the needed stock that customers often request

loans.name: Yasaman

texts.en:
Yasaman is 51 years old and widowed, with one child.  She is a very caring mother.  Her first goal is to give her daughter a good life.  For that Yasaman is working every day without rest. 

She sells office supplies, such as tape, calculators, bulbs, etc.  Her profit in this business is AZN 100 monthly, but that is not enough to take care of her daughter and to buy goods for her store.  She is also very worried about giving her daughter a good education, which will be a great contribution to the society.

Now Yasaman needs a loan of AZN 500.  With this money, she plans to bring more products to the store and increase her sales. She has already taken four loans from Aqroinvest in the past. 

Yasaman is very optimistic about this business, and she awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy more products fon her store

loans.name: Cavanshir

texts.en:
Cavanshir  is a 22-year-old, single man who began working as a butcher five years ago. 

In December 2012, he established his own business, to improve his living. He provides his customers with very good quality meat, at special prices. 

Cavanshir needs a loan of AZN 1,000 to buy cows, which will help to increase his business capital. 

As for the future, Cavanshir wishes to develop his business and to keep it capable of responding to the increasing demand of his customers.

loans.use: to buy cows, which will help to increase his business capital.

loans.name: Heghine

texts.en:
Heghine lives in the village of Geghamavan, which is in the Gegharkunik region. She is 40 years old and married, with a son and a daughter.  Her husband and son are now temporarily in the Russian Federation for working abroad, and Heghine lives with her school-aged daughter and retired mother-in-law. 

Despite being alone, Heghine is very skillfully engaged in farming and agriculture. She breeds on her farm a cow, a calf, two piglets, and 30 chickens. She also cultivates on her plot of land cabbages and potatoes, the sale of which she organizes from her house.  She sells her harvest  to re-sellers.

Heghine asks a loan of AMD 1,000,000 in order to buy a lot of animal fodder for winter and also some seedlings for her agricultural activities.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder for winter and also seedlings for her agricultural activities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bales of cotton materials and dishes

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu is 35 years of age. He is not married. He lives with his parents. Arzu is an IDP person.  He has run a local grocery store for more than 10 years.  In his store he sells different grocery products such as toothbrushes, shampoo, cleaning items, etc.  Arzu is the only breadwinner in the family. 
To be able to keep his small business functioning in a sustainable way, Arzu  needs to make some investments. A loan of 1000 azn  will be a huge support to this hard-working man and will enable him  to purchase more grocery products to resell in his store. The latter will make Arzu’s store more competitive.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married, has four children, and lives in Malindi on the north coast of Kenya. She sell water and the business is doing very well. She also has transport business. She wants to start a charcoal and firewood business.  The challenge in her business are bad debts and competition from other traders.

Gladys is requesting a loan from Milango, which she joined so that she could access capital to fund her business. With the loan, she will buy firewood and charcoal. She hopes that she will be able to diversify her business in the coming years. She will use the income to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and charcoal.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a first-year student at the American University of Central Asia, in the department of European studies, and here is her story:

“I want to serve as a bridge between my country and the European countries. People are convinced that a person who goes to her work with pleasure and comes back home gladly every day is the happiest one. Most of us have been mulling over our future career since childhood. But we change our viewpoints and preferences according to our ages. At first, not all images that we dream about satisfy us. Then we become more realistic and start envisaging the profession we want to choose. This is the choice of our ways and life, the choice of destiny. I have made a choice, which is the European Studies department. I know I would like to work with a community and people in a society is also very interesting for me. I am sure I will get a highly qualified education here at AUCA, which gives lots of different opportunities to its students.

"I would like to mention one of the main opportunities that are open to each student of AUCA – Kiva loans. I would like to apply for Kiva loan, which will give me a chance to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Jegbeh

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 39-year-old Jegbeh from Waterloo 2, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married with seven children between the ages of 3 and 22 years. Two of her children attend school. She started her business to get money for the daily survival of her family.
 
Jegbeh runs a cookery business. She sells cooked food within her area. She has been running this business since 2005. She works at the business twelve hours per day and six days per week.   Jegbeh says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Jegbeh has requested a loan in order to buy food commodities like cooking seasoning, oil, and rice to prepare food for her cookery business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy food commodities like cooking seasoning, oil, and rice to prepare food for her cookery business.

loans.name: Kuriya

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Kuriya from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with four children between the ages of 14 years and 25 years.  She began her business because she wanted to empower herself. In 2005, Kuriya established her fast food business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am to 5:30 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kuriya requires a loan in order to purchase more items like pure water, biscuits, flour, sugar and cooking oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Kuriya plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like pure water, biscuits, flour, sugar and cooking oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Yurik

texts.en:
Yurik is 40 years old and he lives with his family in the frontier village of Zangakatun which is in the Ararat region. After finishing school, Yurik took part  in both the war to defend his native village and the war of Nagorno Karabakh. After that, he got married and he has a very nice daughter. 

Now Yurik is seriously engaged in framing and agriculture. He breeds in his farm two cows, three calves, two piglets, and fifteen chickens. His wife helps him in farming activities greatly, and right from their house she sells milk, cheese, eggs and meat. They also have a very nice fruit garden with different and sweet sorts of apples. They sell their garden harvest at the local wholesale market. 

Yurik wants to increase the number of his farm cattle, and he asks for a loan of 950,000 Armenian drams. He plans to buy a cow and several calves.

loans.use: to buy a cow and several calves in order to increase the number of his farm cattle

loans.name: Gunay

texts.en:
Gunay is 38 years old and single. She sells office supplies, such as tape, calculators, bulbs, etc. Her profit is 100 AZN a month. She does not have enough funds to buy goods. Even though it is a small business, she has a lot of customers and wants to expand her business. 

Gunay is requesting her third loan from Aqroinvest for 1,700 AZN, which she will use to buy more goods. She believes this loan will have a positive impact on the expansion of her business

loans.use: to purchase more goods.

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik is 31 years old and he lives in the village Avshar which is in Ararat region. Arayik is married and he has two children. In his native village Arayik lives with his wife, children and parents. His father works as a driver, his mother is a baker.

Arayik works as a gardener and the only person who is not employed outside the home is his wife, who takes care of their children and their house. Besides his work Arayik is engaged in farming and agriculture and all his family members help him in it. In their farm they have a cow, three piglets and twenty chickens. Their fruit garden is just unbelievably beautiful and bright and it is colored by the harvest of apple trees, pomegranate trees and plums. 

Arayik also cultivates wheat on his plot of land. Since his family is big and problems are a lot without farming income, it would be impossible to live on his salary. So through the farming Arayik perfectly provides his family.

He is asking for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a lot of animal fodder for winter and also some wheat seeds.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder for winter and also some wheat seeds

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is a 33-year-old married man .He is  a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods like shampoo, flour, beverages, macaroni, butter, and candies. He has 8  years of experience and has a deep knowledge of the market and the demands of his clients..

The food products  Elchin   sells are very popular among people and in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 200 AZN. His   brother   is helping him  to purchase products and bring them to the shop. This is the sole financial income in his   family. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of his  good location, in the central bazaar of his  home city.

Elchin applied for a loan of 1500 AZN to purchase more food products and diversify the range of goods to cover his  customers` demands.

loans.use: to purchase more food products

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is predominantly an agriculturalist who rears cows and also does subsistence farming. He concentrates more on cattle-rearing because there is demand for cattle by the people that take them to the city for slaughter. He is confident that if his stock increases then he will make more profits and become a big cattle trader who can load a full truck to the city. He is hard-working.

loans.use: To buy young bulls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more timber to expand his business.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson lives in Malindi, in the northern part of the Kenyan coast. He is widowed and runs a motorcycle business in Malindi. He has been in this business for the last one and a half years and the business has been growing. 

He knew Milango through friends and now he seeks a loan to repair his motorcycle. The challenges that he faces in the business are weather and the low season. He hopes that his business will become stable so that he can improve his living standard.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El cliente reside en la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó con esta actividad en la playa de Santa Rosa, comprando pescado para venderlo a los comerciantes.  Desde ahi, decidió ampliar su mercado e ir a vender a Guayaquil.  Trabaja solo, todos los días desde temprano en la mañana.  Es soltero pero tiene novia y 3 niños menores de edad.  A futuro desea tener su propio vehículo para poder transportar el pescado.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de albacora, bonito y otros tipos de pescado para su comercialización.
texts.en:
This borrower resides in the city of Libertad.  He began his business on the beach in Santa Rosa by buying fish to sell to the merchants.  Since then, he decided to expand his market by selling in Guayaquil.  The borrower works alone every day, starting in the early hours of the morning.  He is single, but he has a girlfriend and three young children.  In the future, he would like to have his own vehicle for transporting fish.

For now, the borrower needs a loan so that he can buy albacore tuna, bonito, and other types of fish that he can sell.

loans.use: to buy albacore tuna, bonito, and other types of fish that he can sell.

loans.name: Rhonda

texts.en:
Through this first Kiva-provided loan, Rhonda successfully moved her salon. The move was good for her business, and she has succeeded in maintaining customers and gaining new ones. In her current location, there are other beauty salons, but Rhonda's professionalism and high quality work has succeeded in differentiating her from the competition. She has even gained customers from the other salons.

Rhonda needed this new loan to allow for additional renovations and to purchase a salon mirror, artificial nail application and maintenance materials, and additional cosmetic treatments.

The new station and mirror will assist in further emphasizing the difference of Rhonda's salon from her competition. Rhonda wants to continue to see her business grow. Eventually she wants to include a wide variety of beauty treatments and programs.

loans.use: To purchase a chair and materials needed for artificial nails, a treatment bed, a hair styling station, and a salon mirror.

loans.name: Dannys Solanlly

texts.es: Dannys, a sus 33 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, vendiendo mercancía desde hace 6 años, esta actividad la aprendió de una amiga y de su hermana mayor quien realiza la misma labor; sus principales clientes son sus familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector donde reside, de esta manera genera los ingresos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar. La cliente es una mujer activa y emprendedora, que siempre va buscando nuevas alternativas para seguir progresando; por ello solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (ropa, accesorios, cosméticos, entre otros); así podrá abastecerse para satisfacer la demanda de productos que aumenta con la temporada de navidad que se aproxima, época en la que se ven beneficiados sus ingresos personales. Dannys manifiesta que su principal objetivo con la labor que realiza, es poder ahorrar ya que en un futuro sueña con abrir su propio taller de confección, pues le apasiona este arte y ve en él una buena fuente de ingresos para seguir avanzando y poder disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Dannys, at 33-years-old, makes a living as an independent merchant selling goods for 6 years. She learned this activity from a friend and her older sister who do the same work. Their main customers are family, friends, and residents from the area where she lives. She generates enough income to contribute to the economy of her home. The client is an active and enterprising woman who is always looking for new ways to keep progressing, hence, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of wholesale merchandise (clothes, accessories, cosmetics, etc.) so she can stock up to meet the demand for products that increases with the approaching Christmas season, a time that is beneficial for her personal income. Dannys says that her main objective for her work is to be able to save and, in the future, she dreams of opening her own clothing shop, as she is passionate about this skill and she sees it as a good source of income to move forward and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale merchandise (clothes, accessories, cosmetics, and others).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, pure water, and toothpaste

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is a 39-year-old married man from Qalqilia city. He lives with his wife and six children (two sons and four daughters) in a small house in the city. Wael works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a very low income. 

For the past ten years, Wael has been working also at raising sheep on a small farm. It is a good project and supports part of the expenses for the family. 

Wael took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep to raise on his farm. This will increase his productivity and also his income. Wael appears in the photo on his farm

loans.use: to buy more sheep to raise on his farm

loans.name: Khader

texts.en:
Khader is 49 years old and married, and he lives in Bethlehem city. He is the father of six sons and one daughter. 

Khader has been working in a carpentry workshop for many years, and he has gained very good experience in this field. Two years ago, Khader decided to open his own carpentry workshop. It is a good business and earns a good income. 

Khader would like to improve his project and buy all the needed materials and equipment.  He has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more materials for his carpentry shop and some equipment to improve his production. This will increase his income and improve his family's living conditions. 

Khader appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more materials for his carpentry shop and some equipment to improve his production

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos en la zona rural de Palo Blando de Pucará a donde su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio de animales menores a dos horas de la ciudad e Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Hace dos años se dedica a la venta de salchipollo y salchipapas su local está ubicado frente a la comisaria de Pucara, además con la ayuda de sus hijos se dedican a la cría de aves de corral, que luego los ofrecen a sus clientes.

Ella es una mejer emprendedora que ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de gaseosas y adicionales para su negocio de alimentos y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 32 years old and lives with her three children in the rural district of Palo Blando de Pucará.  This community, which is known for agriculture and trading small animals, is located two hours away from the city of Jaén.  It is located in the region of Cajamarca, which is in the northern mountains of Peru.  

Tomasa has been selling “salchipollo” (sausages and chicken) and “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes) for two years.  Her stand is located in front of the police station in Pucara.  In addition, her children help her with raising poultry that is eventually served to her customers.  

Tomasa is an enterprising woman who is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN so that she can invest in the purchase of sodas and additional supplies for her food business.  This will help her generate additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy sodas and additional supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Maria Mariana

texts.es:
María Mariana es una señora  muy trabajadora de 47 años de edad, casada, y madre de 3 hijos, ella vive con su esposo y dos de sus hijos 1 menor de edad que está estudiando la primaria y una hija adolescente que le ayuda en los que aceres del hogar. El grado educativo de María es primaria incompleta la cual no pudo terminar por más esfuerzo que hicieron sus padres como ella también ya que desciende de una familia de escasos recursos económicos.
María desde  hace 7 años  se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo particularmente al cultivo de café; Esta actividad la aprendió con sus padres ya que desde niña la llevaban a trabajar (cortar café) a fincas de otras personas para poder sobrevivir.
El terreno donde hoy en día tienen su finca lo adquirieron con mucho esfuerzo es por eso que ella se siente motivada y desea ver su terreno cultivado, el cual está ubicado a 4 kilómetros de su casa, ella todas las mañanas junto a su esposo caminan 25 minutos para llegar a  su finca donde trabajan arduamente  para  limpiar y cuidar su cultivo ya que temen que alguna plaga se los dañe, sin embargo ellos son optimistas y afirman que obtendrán una excelente  cosecha de café.
Por lo que  ella necesita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas para dar asistencia técnica a su cultivo de café como ser compra de abono, foliares, fertilizantes entre otros.
 Ella sueña hacer crecer su finca, sembrar y cultivar plantación nueva de café  ya que es la única forma de asegurar el futuro de su familia ya que la situación económica cada día es precaria; además ella enseñara a sus hijos a trabajar para que sean personas de bien y valoren el esfuerzo que sus padres hacen por salir adelante y tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
María Mariana is a hard-working woman of 47 years of age.  She is married and mother of three children. Two of  the children live with them. One is studying in primary school and the other is an adolescent who helps with the household work. Maria did not complete her primary school studies as much as her parents tried. Her family had very modest economic resources.

For the past 7 years Maria has worked alongside her husband farming, in particular growing coffee. She learned this activity as a child who accompanied her parents at work (harvesting coffee) on other people's plantations in order to survive. 

She worked very hard to obtain her plantation. This is her motivation and she wants to see her land under cultivation. It is located 4 kilometers from her house and every morning her and her husband walk the 25 minutes it takes to get to the plantation. They work hard to clean and care for their crops as they are worried about infestations. However they are optimistic and affirm that they will have an excellent harvest.

For this reason Maria needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies to apply technical support for her coffee crops buying fertilizer, foliar spray, manure etc. She dreams of expanding her plantation as this is her only way of securing her family's future given that each day's financial situation is precarious. Also she will teach her children to work so that they can be good people who value the efforts of their parents to get ahead and lead a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Maria Otilia

texts.es:
Doña María Otilia es una mujer de 47 años de edad muy luchadora, con muchos sueños y muchas fuerzas la cual es viuda y madre de 4 hijos, los cuales 2 ya son mayores y están en hogares a parte, el tercer hijo vive con un tío y la última hija es estudiante de primaria en una escuela de la comunidad siendo ella la única que vive con ella. Con ella también viven sus padres y ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo la cual pudo terminar gracias al apoyo y esfuerzo de sus padres. Doña María Otilia aprendió el rubro y oficio de la agricultura desde muy pequeña ya que ella apoyaba a sus padres en sus cultivos de café por lo que en la actualidad tiene 10 años de ejercer dicho rubro. La tierra que trabaja fue una herencia de sus padres la cual está ubicada a 3 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación. Sus clientes son lo diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona en busca de un producto de calidad.
Ella sueña con tener una casa en mejores condiciones, poder sacar a su familia adelante y poder también cultivar una manzana de tierra con una mejor variedad de café la cual sea más atractiva para sus clientes y demás.
